item.title: Posting Huge Loss, Wachovia Tries to Purge Lending Woes
item.description: Moving quickly to put an end to the spill of red ink, the bank booked an $8.9 billion loss and slashed its dividend in its first quarter under new leadership.
item.dc:creator: By ERIC DASH

item.title: As Loan Giants Are Inspected, Bush Prods Congress
item.description: Treasury Secretary Henry M. Paulson Jr. said that examiners are inspecting the books of Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac.
item.dc:creator: By STEPHEN LABATON

item.title: Serbian Officials Provide Details on Arrest of Karadzic
item.description: Radovan Karadzic, one of the most wanted war criminals until his arrest for a 1995 massacre, had been living freely in Belgrade, authorities said.
item.dc:creator: By DAN BILEFSKY and MARLISE SIMONS
item.category: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity

item.title: Another Construction Vehicle Attack in Israel
item.description: A construction vehicle plowed into traffic near the Jerusalem hotel where Barack Obama was to stay, injuring at least 24 people before the driver was killed.
item.dc:creator: By ISABEL KERSHNER and GRAHAM BOWLEY

item.title: The Caucus: Obama, in Jordan, Must Navigate Mideast Conflict
item.description: When Barack Obama meets with King Abdullah, his approach to the peace process will be watched carefully.
item.dc:creator: By JEFF ZELENY

item.title: Ford to Make Broader Bet on Small Cars
item.description: After two decades focused on trucks, the company is about to drastically shift focus to building smaller cars.
item.dc:creator: By BILL VLASIC
item.category: Utility Vehicles and Other Light Trucks

item.title: Chaotic Debate on Major Vote in India
item.description: An acrimonious debate on a confidence motion on the government came to an abrupt halt after a demonstration by opposition lawmakers.
item.dc:creator: By SOMINI SENGUPTA

item.title: Talks to Start on Zimbabwe Crisis
item.description: South Africa is hoping to convene negotiations between Zimbabwe’s feuding political parties on Tuesday, one day after their leaders met face to face.
item.dc:creator: By ALAN COWELL and GRAHAM BOWLEY

item.title: Women Are Now Equal as Victims of Poor Economy
item.description: Women in the workplace are being afflicted by the same troubles as men. And they are responding as men have, by dropping out or disappearing for a while.
item.dc:creator: By LOUIS UCHITELLE

item.title: So Soon? Fares and Tolls Rise in M.T.A. Plan
item.description: A substantial increase in fares and tolls is planned to help close a widening budget gap of nearly $900 million.
item.dc:creator: By WILLIAM NEUMAN

item.title: Rings: Bush Asked to Reject Marion Jones Request
item.description: The C.E.O. of USA Track and Field issues a sharply worded letter asking that President Bush deny Marion Jones's request for a commutation.
item.dc:creator: By JEFF Z. KLEIN

item.title: The Lede: Blackwater Plans to Drop Guard Work
item.description: Blackwater is giving up on the business that put them in the crosshairs of an astonishing array of parties.
item.dc:creator: By MIKE NIZZA

item.title: Well: More Sex for Today’s Seniors
item.description: A study of four generations of 70-year-olds shows that today's seniors have better sex lives.
item.dc:creator: By TARA PARKER-POPE

item.title: City Room: Where Superheroes Get Their Supplies
item.description: Those who can't afford to hire inventors (like Batman) or engineer devices themselves (like Iron Man), can head to the Brooklyn Superhero Supply Store in Park Slope.
item.dc:creator: By JENNIFER 8. LEE

item.title: Goal: Adu Moves From Benfica to Monaco on Loan
item.description: U.S. midfielder Freddy Adu will move from Benfica in Portugal to Monaco in France on a season-long loan with a chance for a permanent transfer.
item.dc:creator: By JEFFREY MARCUS

item.title: ArtsBeat: At Tanglewood, Elliott Carter’s Sketches
item.description: The best of the nonperformance offerings so far at the Festival of Contemporary Music is "Carter's Century: An Exhibit Celebrating the Life and Music of Elliott Carter," split between two buildings on the Tanglewood campus.
item.dc:creator: By ALLAN KOZINN

item.title: Joe Nocera: Killing Icahn With Kindness
item.description: Looks Like Yahoo has figured out how to neuter Carl Icahn - kill him with kindness. That would seem to be the lesson emerging from Monday's announcement that the 77-year-old shareholder activist, along with Jonathan Miller, who used to run Time Warner's AOL division, will be joining the Yahoo board. It seems pretty likely [...].
item.dc:creator: By JOE NOCERA
